p: The 0.4% pomelo peel essential oil emulsion mixed with 0.03% water-soluble chitosan had a significant antibacterial effect on S. aureus and E. coli ( p < 0.05) ( Table 4). In addition, the MIC values of this mixture for S. aureus and E. coli were 0.019% and 0.034%, respectively. As such, the MIC value of this mixture for S. aureus was higher than that of the 0.01% water-soluble chitosan, but the value for E. coli was nearest to the 0.03% water-soluble chitosan. Therefore, we further analyzed the antibacterial activity and stability of this mixture at various pH values.
